definition: to mess up/to put into disorder/to meddle with/to confuse
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: On WHT and many other places, you only hear about it when it messes up.
sentences.chinese: 在西隧和許多其他地方，你只能聽到它時它弄亂。

sentences.english: You messed up your hair riding so hard.
sentences.chinese: 你騎得那麼賣勁，把頭髮都弄亂了。
這不過是弄亂你的頭髮罷了。

sentences.english: "No muss, no fuss" is a great slogan to remember.
sentences.chinese: “沒有弄亂，無事”是一個偉大的口號記住。

sentences.english: You can't derange , or re-arrange, your poems again.
sentences.chinese: 你無法再弄亂，或重新整編你的詩篇。

sentences.english: Please don't mix my papers up.
sentences.chinese: 請不要把我的文件弄亂了。

sentences.english: Frustrated, he swings his arms about, scattering the strips of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 失望的他揮動手臂，弄亂地上的布條。

sentences.english: He said Le had broken bones and that her underwear had been disarranged.
sentences.chinese: 他說，樂有骨折，她的內衣已被弄亂。

sentences.english: The child had disarrayed the books.
The boy jiggered up the machinery in his first attempt at fixing the clock.
sentences.chinese: 男孩一動手修鍾就把機件弄亂了。

sentences.english: Is Jason all ticked off that we trashed his house?
sentences.chinese: 關於我們把他家弄亂這件事，傑森生氣了嗎？

sentences.english: The old man blew up to those naughty boys who had disarrayed his corp.
sentences.chinese: 那個老人對那些弄亂他莊稼的搗蛋鬼。

sentences.english: You confuse me, and how can I transact business if I am confused?
sentences.chinese: 你把我的心弄亂了。心弄亂了怎麼能搞業務呢？
